Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 restructuring

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> Between code that I cannot reuse at all and code that I can reuse but that
> might break in the future, I will take my chances with the latter any day.

Let's be careful to get our terms straight. Code reuse does not always 
mean extending a class. Much more often it means simply using the class 
without modifying it in any way. Delegation is the bread and butter of 
reuse in OOP. Inheritance is a garnish best used sparingly.

Given the choice between a class I can safely reuse in obvious way, and 
a class that requires me to read pages of half-thought-out documentation 
and then inspect the source code to try and figure out what's really 
going on because Java programmers almost never bother to document their 
pre and post-conditions, I will choose the former any day.

--
